Silica; Quartz; Cristobalite; Tridymite; Amorphous silicon dioxide; Silicon(IV) oxide; Siliceous earth; Diatomaceous earth; Silica gel

common:classification.name: ILCD 1.1
common:classification.common:class: Metal and semimetal elements and ions

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Silicon dioxide, commonly known as silica, is a natural compound made of two of the earth's most abundant materials: silicon (Si) and oxygen (O2). It's known for its hardness and resistance to high temperatures and is used in various applications from electronic components to construction materials. It often comes in the form of sand, quartz, or flint and is used in glass-making, as a food additive (anti-caking agent), in silicon chips, and as a component of hydraulic fracturing fluids in the oil industry. Silicon dioxide is available in various purity levels and may be produced synthetically or derived naturally.
二氧化硅，通常被称为硅砂，是由地球上最丰富的两种材料：硅（Si）和氧（O2）组成的天然化合物。它以硬度高和耐高温而闻名，并用于从电子元件到建筑材料的各种应用。它通常以沙子，石英或燧石的形式出现，用于制造玻璃，作为食品添加剂（防结块剂），用于硅芯片，以及作为油行业水力压裂流体的组成部分。二氧化硅有不同的纯度级别，并且可以是合成产生或自然衍生。
